trustfund:
TF058077-BANK PROJECT APPRAISAL AND
            SUPERVISION FOR JAVA RECONSTRUCTION FUND

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall objective of the Access to
            Finance and Capacity Building for Earthquake-Affected Micro
            and Small Enterprises Project is to contribute to the
            Government's of Indonesia's initiatives to support
            the recovery of Micro and Small Enterprises (MSEs) in
            Yogyakarta and Central Java and enable them to reach at
            least pre-earthquake capacity through enhanced access to
            finance and targeted technical assistance. There are six
            components to the project. The first component of the
            project is assessment for identification of
            interventions/targeting beneficiaries. Under this component
            the International Organization for Migration (IOM) will
            conduct livelihood, market and environmental surveys in
            order to fine-tune the implementation strategy for
            assistance to Micro and Small Enterprises (MSEs). The second
            component of the project is asset replacement. Under this
            component, IOM will purchase goods and provide them as in
            kind support to restore infrastructure and physical assets
            that are essential for operations of MSEs, such as
            production facilities, livelihood tools, irrigation systems,
            small roads, warehouses, sheds, pens, and other essential
            small-scale infrastructure. The third component of the
            project is access to finance. Under this component, small
            loans will be provided to MSEs, including community
            enterprises, associations, cooperatives, etc. The fourth
            component of the project is assistance for market access.
            Under this component the project will finance Technical
            Assistance (TA) to help MSEs recover former buyers and
            customers or to identify new ones. The fifth component of
            the project is capacity building technical assistance. Under
            this component, the project will invest in TA and training
            for skills development and capacity building for the MSEs.
            Training envisaged under this component includes
            entrepreneurial skills such as financial management and
            marketing and business plan development. The six component
            of the project is project management and monitoring and
            evaluation. Under this component the project will finance
            all costs associated with management, implementation, and
            supervision of the project incurred by the IOM.
